questions.question: Using the base HRSD configuration with no integrations, when the subject person electronically signs an HR document or PDF document, the signature is saved as what?
answers: B. a picture of the signature that is added to the document

comments.content: HR Fundamentals ebook page 117: E-signatures are not the same as digital signatures. E-signatures are an image, or picture, of your signature placed on a document to represent an acknowledgement or approval.

questions.question: What role needs to be removed from the Admin role at go live to prevent the System Admin from being able to see HR Profile information?

comments.content:
HR Fund > Access to Confidential Information is Restricted

Some HR profile information, such as Department, is synchronized between the User [sys_user] and HR Profile [hr_profile] tables. Updating information in one record automatically applies the updates to the other. After the HR application is configured and ready to go live, the HR Admin role may be removed from the System Administrator. When the HR Admin role is removed from the Admin role, the System administrator can still view the HR Profile record from the user record, but they will only see the information that is also visible on the User table. The confidential fields, like Beneficiaries, are visible only to HR professionals.

answers: A. It means a high score is bad

C. There is no option for Scale definition

questions.question:

By default, what is the Caller Access field set to?

comments.content: HR Implementation ebook page 37: By default, the Caller Access field for all HR tables is set to Caller Restriction.

comments.content:
From the implementation training book:
"Configuration complexity is the key factor when developing an implementation timeline"

questions.question: Beginning with the Orlando release, which module allows HR Administrators to define which groups may access the various COEs or HR Services without needing to edit or create new ACL records?

comments.content: HR Implementation ebook page 151: The COE Security Configuration module allows admins to restrict access to all cases on a COE or to specific HR Services without creating ACL records.

questions.question:
A customer using Lifecycle Events Enterprise has documented a large offboarding Lifecycle Event that includes many steps. Many of the steps, including approvals, must be completed in a specific order.
Which of these is the best method to use to ensure the activities are triggered in the appropriate order?
answers: A. Create a new lifecycle event for each of the dependent items
B. Create separate trigger conditions for each of the dependent activities
C. Create activity containers for the dependent items
D. Create separate activity sets for each of the dependent activities

comments.content: Configure a lifecycle event activity that is a container for a group of activities. This activity type enables you to manage the dependencies of activities within an activity set. You can use activity containers to order activities, in parallel or sequence, as well as configure multiple activity containers within an activity set.

questions.question: What kinds of records can be created using HR Service Activities? (Choose two.)

How can a PDF document on an active HR case be generated? (Choose two.)
answers: B. By the Subject Person’s manager
D. By the Assigned to person

comments.content: HR Professional is case Assigned to. So only D.

Correct answers: A, D
HR Fundamentals - Vancouver, p. 120 - Documents can be generated Automatically by the system or by an HR professional.
Correct answer is A and D.

Remember, an HR Service is needed to initiate the Lifecycle Event.

page 79 of Tokyo implementation guide "4. Create HR Service which will initiate the Lifecycle event"

questions.question: In Employee Document Management, which of the following statements is true for legal holds?
answers: A. Legal Holds are permanent and cannot be removed
B. Legal Holds may be placed on a group of HR profiles
C. Legal Holds may be placed on either a Document Type or an individual employee’s HR Profile
D. Legal Holds may be manually placed on individual employee documents

comments.content: HR Implementation ebook page 138: Legal Holds may be placed on an entire Document Type or on an employee's HR Profile to prevent documents from being edited or purged

questions.question: Each HR service created in _______ has a corresponding transform map job.

comments.content: B: HR Integration Service seems correct.

questions.question: If the Workflow editor is utilized for a Lifecycle Event, how does the system know when a task or approval should be triggered?
answers: B. The activity set trigger condition determines when it is triggered
C. Activities are automatically triggered on specific dates
D. The Activity trigger condition determines when it is triggered

comments.content:
Why is "Activity Trigger Condition" correct?
Activity Trigger Condition is a specific configuration within a workflow that defines the conditions under which individual activities, such as tasks and approvals, should be triggered. For example, a task might be triggered when a lifecycle event reaches a certain state or when specific conditions related to the employee or the case are met.

The trigger condition evaluates whether the required criteria are met to activate an activity in the workflow, such as when an HR case reaches a specific state, a date arrives, or certain fields are set. This mechanism ensures that tasks and approvals happen automatically at the correct time in the lifecycle process.

Page 81 on HR Implementation - Tokyo book:
- Trigger conditions: defines when the activity set should be initiated.
When the Activity set is triggered, all Activities within it are triggered as well.
HR Implementation ebook page 82: The Activity Set Trigger Conditions field tells the system when an Activity Set should begin and Business Rules control the behavior.
Answer B. HRSD Implemntation ebook page 82.

questions.question: What Primary Security aspects are focused on for the HR application? (Choose three.)

A customer using Lifecycle Events Enterprise has configured their onboarding process. Now, management has tasked the HR Admin with creating a way to back out onboarding work in case the new employee decides not to join the company.
Which of these is the best method to use to reverse work already performed as part of this Lifecycle Event?
answers: A. Check the “allow blackout” box on each of the activities
B. Configure a new Lifecycle Event with the necessary activities
C. Configure the rescind activity set with the necessary activities
D. Check the “allow blackout” box on each of the activity sets

comments.content: HR Implementation ebook page 89: Cancel and revert work done in a lifecycle event case with the rescind process.

questions.question: What identifies data from HRSD to push to a third-party HR application?

comments.content: HR Implementation ebook page 176: with an outbound integration, data is pushed from the HR tables or HR service in HRSD to the third-party HR management system. The HR outbound schema mappings map the data from the source tables to the fields in the target system.

questions.question: When configuring the Onboarding Lifecycle Event, the HR Admin did not select an Audience for the 'Select a Desk' task. If a remote employee is being onboarded. how does the system handle this task?
answers: A. The Lifecycle Event rescind process will be triggered
B. The activity will be skipped
C. The Lifecycle Event will be canceled
D. The activity will be triggered and must be manually closed

comments.content:
Correct: D. 
The activity set will trigger.

If no audience record is selected, then the activity for the activity to trigger in the case.
The audience criteria for an activity set applies first. When the audience criteria is met, the activity set executes. The audience at the activity level is then checked and executed.

You cannot set an audience for activity sets that have a trigger type of Rescind.
if there isn't an audience record, the activity is triggered

questions.question: When configuring a record on the COE ACL Configuration module how can you apply the conditions to all HR services for the COE?
answers: A. Add a filter condition for each HR service
B. Select the Applies to all services box
C. Write a new ACL record for each HR service
D. Select each HR service using the Services list

comments.content: B is the correct answer - p. 151 from HR Implementation - Tokyo eBook
B - see page 151 of Implementation guide (Tokyo) - 2nd Note

questions.question: If you have both Admin [admin] and HR Admin [sn_hr_core.admin] roles and want to configure an Access Control Rule for the HR Payroll table, which of the following must first be done?
answers: A. Manually add the Delegated Developer role to your User record
B. Manually add the security_admin role to your User record
C. From the User dropdown in the banner, elevate your role to delegated_developer
D. From the User dropdown in the banner, elevate your role to security_admin

comments.content: It’s rather D, because if you do not have security_admin you cannot just add it. You would need to elevate to security_admin first.

It depends.. 
The security_admin role is not automatically granted to Admins.. 
So if the ACL needs to be created and this Admin does not have the role, the first thing that needs to be done is B.
Else, if he already has the role, Elevating to Security Admin role is the correct answer (D)

B. Advise the customer this work must be completed in Production
C. Grant them delegated developer role only to the HR Integrations application scope
D. Submit an exception request to allow them to have the Admin role

questions.question: When an employee contacts HR, they speak in terms of lifecycle events. From an HR perspective, that event gets translated into several HR services that need to be performed. Of the following items, which would be considered a lifecycle event?

comments.content: Answer is B: Parental Leave = lifecycle event

questions.question: All ServiceNow web traffic uses which data protocol to ensure data is always TLS encrypted in transit.

Scenario: Alex is a member of the HR Tier 1 group which grants him the HR Basic [sn_hr_core.basic] role. He is going to be out of the office for a few days and wants to use granular delegation to allow his friend Amy to complete his tasks. Amy is not yet a member of any HR groups, but hopes to transfer into HR one day. Will granular delegation work for this purpose?
answers: A. Yes. Granular delegation will automatically grant the necessary roles
B. Yes. Granular delegation will automatically add Amy to the HR Tier 1 group where she will inherit the role.
C. Partially. Granular delegation will allow Amy access to the HR Tasks, but not to the HR Case itself.
D. No. Granular delegation does not change a delegate's access to records.

comments.content:
100% D

Servicenow Docs:

Important: Granular delegation does not change a delegate's access to records. To access records, a delegate must already have the necessary roles. For example, to delegate task records, a delegate must have a role such as itil to access the Task table and its extensions.
Ebook claims that delegation does not change roles assignment, so D.
D is quoted from the e-book.
Answer is D.  Page 152 of Implementation ebook (Tokyo) -  "granular delegation does not change a delegate's access to records"
Answer is D.  Page 160 of eBook (Rome)...  "granular delegation does not change a delegate's access to records"

B is correct. 

"Granular delegation allows employees to delegate their tasks to other employees for specific date and time ranges based on delegation rules.

Granular delegation provides the ability to delegate specific records by table and condition. It also allows admins to delegate approvals and/or task assignments for task tables they administer."

Source: https://docs.servicenow.com/en-US/bundle/utah-employee-service-management/page/product/employee-service-management/granular-delegation/concept/granular-delegation.html

questions.question: Which Lifecycle Event activity type enables you to manage the dependencies or order of activities within an activity set?

comments.content: HR Implementation ebook page 87: activity containers allow you to manage the dependencies of activities within an activity set. You can use activity containers to establish the order in which activities should occur.

Can edit journey: Allows a user to modify a journey. Managers can enable mentors to modify an employee's journey.

Change only the task templates that they own.
Manage the order and flow of the journey stages and tasks.

comments.content: Manage large numbers of documents more efficiently with the ServiceNow ™ Employee Document Management product. Employee Document Management provides storage space, a filing system, the ability to easily retrieve documents, defining who can view sensitive documents, and when to purge documents.

questions.question: What is the minimum role required to view confidential data associated with the HR Profile?

comments.content:
D. HR profile viewer [sn_hr_core.profile_reader]
The [sn_hr_core.basic] role contains [sn_hr_core.profile_writer], which contains the [sn_hr_core.profile_reader] role, so B cannot be correct.

HR Fundamentals ebook page 74: The confidential fields, like Beneficiaries, are visible only to HR professionals. So all HR professionals, so the reader role (which is part of the basic role) should be enough.

comments.content: HR Fundamentals ebook page 232: Listening Posts enable you to quickly capture in-the-moment feedback from micro experiences from employees. Admins can create and trigger short Pulse Surveys across various stages of an employee journey.
